definition[0]: to steal things, especially from shops or homes that have been damaged in a war or riot
definition[1]: goods taken by soldiers from a place where they have won a battle
definition[2]: goods or money that have been stolen
definition[3]: things that you have bought or been given in large amounts â€“ used humorously
example[1]: Jodie came home from the mall with bags of loot.
definition[4]: a magazine, sold in the UK and the US, which only contains advertisements. It is typically used by people who want to sell their cars or old furniture, rent their homes, buy a house etc. It also appears on the Internet.
